Path CDA Path CdaPath String 27 1.0
chartLink BaseProperty JavaScript: alert('{series}','{categories}','{value}') Fusion Chart Link Fusion Chart Link String String 87 true 1.0

seriesParam BaseProperty series Fusion Chart seriesParam name Fusion Chart seriesParam name String String 89 true 1.0

String 89 false 1.0

String 89 false 1.0

RealTimeColumn RealTimeLine RealTimeStackedArea RealTimeLineDY AngularGauge
canvasBgColor BaseProperty
Canvas Background Color Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma. Color String 120 TRUE 1
canvasBorderThickness BaseProperty
Canvas Border Thickness Lets you specify canvas border thickness. Integer Number 121 TRUE 1
bgColor BaseProperty
Chart Background Color This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute Color String 122 TRUE 1
showBorder BaseProperty
Chart Border Whether to show a border around the chart or not? Boolean Boolean 123 TRUE 1
borderColor BaseProperty
Chart Border Color Border color of the chart. Color String 124 TRUE 1
caption BaseProperty
Chart Caption Caption of the chart. String String 60 FALSE 1
subCaption BaseProperty
Chart Sub Caption Sub-caption of the chart. String String 61 FALSE 1
xAxisName BaseProperty
X Axis Name X-Axis Title of the Chart. String String 62 FALSE 1
yAxisName BaseProperty
Y Axis Name Y-Axis Title of the chart. String String 63 FALSE 1
refreshInterval BaseProperty
Data Refresh Interval For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data Integer Number 64 FALSE 1
clearChartInterval BaseProperty
Clear Chart Interval The time after which the chart will keep clearing its contents. Integer Number 125 TRUE 1
numDisplaySets BaseProperty 15 Max number of data points to plot This value helps you specify the number of data items that you want as history on the chart. For example, when you set it as 50, only 50 data items (per dataset) will be displayed on the chart. As soon as the 51st data comes in, the first data will be deleted and the rest of the data will be shifted by 1 position left - the new data will come and take the last position. Integer Number 126 TRUE 1
showYAxisValues BaseProperty
Show Y Axis Values The y-axis of charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not Boolean Boolean 127 TRUE 1
yAxisValueDecimals BaseProperty
Y axis decimal places Decimal places for y-axis values. Integer Number 128 TRUE 1
showLabels BaseProperty
X axis show labels It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not. Boolean Boolean 129 TRUE 1
labelDisplay BaseProperty
X axis label display Using this attribute, you can control how your data labels (x-axis labels) will appear on the chart. There are 4 options: WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. WRAP wraps the label text if it's longer than the allotted area. ROTATE rotates the label in vertical or slanted position. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.
String 130 TRUE 1
NONE ROTATE STAGGER WRAP
slantLabels BaseProperty
X axis slant labels (for ROTATE) If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones. Boolean Boolean 131 TRUE 1
labelStep BaseProperty
X axis label step By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attributes just lets you do so. It allows you to display every n(th) X-axis label. Integer Number 132 TRUE 1
showValues BaseProperty
X axis show values Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart. Boolean Boolean 133 TRUE 1
placeValuesInside BaseProperty
X axis place values inside If you've opted to show data values, you can show them inside the columns using this attribute. By default, the data values show outside the column. Boolean Boolean 134 TRUE 1
rotateValues BaseProperty
X axis rotate values If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute. Boolean Boolean 135 TRUE 1
showLegend BaseProperty
Show legend Whether to show legend for the chart (only multi-series and combination charts)? Boolean Boolean 65 FALSE 1
legendPosition BaseProperty
Legend Position The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.
String 136 TRUE 1
RIGHT BOTTOM
formatNumber BaseProperty
Number format This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 ifformatNumber='0'. Boolean Boolean 137 TRUE 1
numberPrefix BaseProperty
Number Prefix Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000. String String 138 TRUE 1
numberSuffix BaseProperty
Number Suffix Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please seeAdvanced Charting > Number Formatting section. String String 139 TRUE 1
decimals BaseProperty
Number of Decimal points Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting section. Integer Number 140 TRUE 1
formatNumberScale BaseProperty
Format number scale (K,M) Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end Boolean Boolean 141 TRUE 1
baseFont BaseProperty
Base Font This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify outCnvBaseFont attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds. String String 142 TRUE 1
baseFontSize BaseProperty
Base Font Size This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here. Integer Number 143 TRUE 1
baseFontColor BaseProperty
Base Font Color This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here. Color String 144 TRUE 1
stack100Percent BaseProperty false Stack 100 Percent Setting this attribute to 1 helps in depicting the values in percentage figures. When this attribute is set to 1 the chart considers the total of the stacked dataplot as 100% and the Y-Axis shows a scale from 0% to 100%. Boolean Boolean 145 TRUE 1
"
showPercentValues BaseProperty
Show Percent Values Whether to show percentage figures in data values of the chart. Boolean Boolean 146 TRUE 1
showPercentInToolTip BaseProperty
Show Percent In Tool Tip Whether to show percentage figures in tooltip. Boolean Boolean 147 TRUE 1
ChartCategoriesParam BaseProperty
Fusion Chart categoriesParam name
String String 32 TRUE 1
ChartSeriesParam BaseProperty
Fusion Chart seriesParam name
String String 31 TRUE 1
ChartValueParam BaseProperty
Fusion Chart valueParam name
String String 33 TRUE 1
xAxisName BaseProperty
X Axis Name X-Axis Title of the Chart. String String 62 FALSE 1
PYAxisName BaseProperty
Primary Y Axis Name Primary Y-Axis title String String 63 FALSE 1
SYAxisName BaseProperty
Secondary Y Axis Name Secondary Y-Axis title String String 66 FALSE 1
sYAxisValueDecimals BaseProperty
Secondary Y axis decimal places Decimal places for y-axis values on secondary y-axis. Integer Number 148 TRUE 1
isDataStreamAngularGauge BaseProperty true Data Stream Angular Gauge Enable the Data Stream Angular Gauge Boolean Boolean 148 TRUE 1
showValue BaseProperty 1 Show Gauge Value Whether to show each dial's value? Boolean Boolean 67 FALSE 1
valueBelowPivot BaseProperty 1 Show Value Below Pivot Whether to show dial value below the pivot or above it? Boolean Boolean 149 TRUE 1
lowerLimitDisplay BaseProperty
Gauge Lower Limit Label This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the lower limit. For example, in a chart displaying Literacy Rate on a scale of 0-100%, you may need to show the label Low at the starting point of the chart. Upon using this attribute to specify the label, the value 0 will be replaced by Low. Default value: If you do not specify the lowerLimitDisplay attribute, the lower limit value will be shown. String String 68 FALSE 1
upperLimitDisplay BaseProperty
Gauge Upper Limit Label This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the upper limit. Upon using this attribute, the upper limit of the chart gets replaced by the label specified. Default value: If you do not specify the upperLimitDisplay attribute, the upper limit value will be shown. String String 69 FALSE 1
showTickMarks BaseProperty 1 Show Tick Marks Whether to show tick marks? Boolean Boolean 150 TRUE 1
showTickValues BaseProperty 1 Show Tick Values Whether to show tick values? Boolean Boolean 151 TRUE 1
showLimits BaseProperty 1 Show Tick Limits Whether to show the first and last tick value (i.e., chart lower and upper limit)? Boolean Boolean 152 TRUE 1
placeTicksInside BaseProperty 1 Place Tick Inside Whether to place ticks inside the gauge (on the inner radius) or outside? Boolean Boolean 153 TRUE 1
placeValuesInside BaseProperty 1 Place Values Inside Whether to place tick values inside the gauge? Boolean Boolean 154 TRUE 1
autoAlignTickValues BaseProperty 1 Auto Align Tick Values Whether to ask the chart to automatically place tick values to reduce overlapping of the tick values with the gauge. Boolean Boolean 155 TRUE 1
gaugeStartAngle BaseProperty 180 Gauge Start Angle Angle from where the gauge will start drawing. Default value is 180. Integer Number 70 FALSE 1
gaugeEndAngle BaseProperty 0 Gauge End Angle Angle where the gauge will end drawing. Default value is 0. Integer Number 71 FALSE 1
showGaugeBorder BaseProperty
Show Gauge Border Whether to show a border around gauge scale? Boolean Boolean 156 TRUE 1
gaugeBorderColor BaseProperty
Gauge Border Color Color of gauge scale border. You can either specify a hex code here (like 333333), or a single token from gradient fill mix like {dark-20} or {light-30}. The chart will then calculate the border color for each color range individually (based on the color code for each color range). Color String 157 TRUE 1
gaugeBorderThickness BaseProperty
Gauge Border Thickness Thickness of gauge scale border. Integer Number 158 TRUE 1
colorRange BaseProperty "[]" Range Colors Array Colors to use in the intervals range. Array Array FALSE 9 1.0
rangeValues BaseProperty "[]" Intervals Array Array - Intervals to use on the dial Array Array FALSE 9 1.0
categoriesColor BaseProperty
Color List for Categories Sets the color for each categorie acording to de category index. ONLY on Multi Series Charts and Real Time Charts Array Array TRUE 9 1.0
parentYAxis BaseProperty
Parent Y Axis parentYAxis to each serie Array Array TRUE 10 1.0
